hints.content:
Cris takes $\purpleD{583}$ steps. That equals the $\maroonD{567}$ steps Maia takes, plus some more steps.

![A tape diagram models that the 583 steps Cris takes are equal to the 567 steps Maia takes and an unknown number of more steps.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1277677e953271b808f9fb961189910aa527835d)

$\purpleD{583}-\maroonD{567}=\blueE{?}$

![Part 1 of 2. Place value blocks show 583 blocks with 567 blocks crossed out](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5f160fcd031c789d292b060c5dfd9c4618edf073)

![Part 2 of 2 of previous image.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/58ac216c267204ba7d6294240416b5221d52a2e2)
Maia takes $\blueE{16}$ fewer steps than Cris.

question.content:
The table shows how many steps it takes each child to cross the playground.

Child | Steps
:- | -:
Anna | $675$
Jaiden | $783$
Maia | $567$
Cris | $583$

**How many fewer steps does Maia take than Cris?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] steps
